SafetyInspectionBy: FL Div. of Emergency Management RMP Agency

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kinder Morgan CFPL Orlando Terminal - Orlando Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2014 Edition at the time of construction) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify Orange County Fire and Rescue as well as the Orange County Department of Emergency and Safety. Emergency Management. Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Medical Services and Orlando Regional Medical Center.



Kinder Morgan CFPL Orlando Terminal - Orlando Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and two butane storage vessels.



Kinder Morgan CFPL Orlando Terminal - Orlando Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) along with its fourteen (14) compliance elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer (Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals L.P.).



This facility has never had an accident involving the butane process which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Kinder Morgan CFPL Orlando Terminal - Orlando Terminal butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact Orange County Fire and Rescue (Primary Responder) and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated w

ith the fire department and the Orange County Department of Emergency and Safety. Ornage County Fire and Rescue has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system and response actions are coordinated at least annually.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessels, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices.



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Kinder Morgan CFPL Orlando Terminal looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Orange County Fire and Rescue is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additionally, Kinder Morgan CFPL Orlando Terminal will work cooperatively with the community to address any concerns.
